data.title: New Judges Named in L.A. International Screenplay Awards
data.meta_description: The Los Angeles International Screenplay Awards, Hollywood's premier venue for aspiring as well as seasoned film and television writers to have their work read, analyzed, and reviewed by some of the entertainment industry's leading exponents of quality script material, has revealed the names of thei
data.text:
The Los Angeles International Screenplay Awards, Hollywood's premier venue for aspiring as well as seasoned film and television writers to have their work read, analyzed, and reviewed by some of the entertainment industry's leading exponents of quality script material, has revealed the names of their 2017 competition judges.

Considered the leading screenplay and TV script competition in the business, the LAISA is unique among all other so-called "script festivals" or "contests" in that its winners gain immediate access to Hollywood decision-makers.

Because each of the LAISA judges works in film and television on a daily basis and has an extensive list of produced credits, submitted material is judged on a purely professional basis. These judges have personal histories of helping writers, directors, and actors break into the business by signing with major talent agencies like CAA, WME, ICM, etc., or by selling original material to the major Hollywood studios, including Universal Pictures, Paramount, Fox, and Warner Bros.

The most recent additions to the LAISC 2017 judging panel include:

Stuart Benjamin, Oscar-nominated Grammy-winning producer of such major feature films as Ray, La Bamba, White Knights, and The Long Walk Home.

Marc Pariser, former CAA and WME packaging agent, responsible for the discovery of writers, producers, and directors, and guiding some of the most successful careers in Hollywood.

Jeffrey Scott, Emmy and Humanitas Award-winning writer-producer with hundreds of animated and live action feature and TV credits working alongside Jim Henson, Stan Lee, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and Stevie Wonder; the acclaimed author of How to Write for Animation.

Suzanne Herrera, former film and television actress, writer of Zorro, High Tide, and Falcon Crest. Actively consulting other writers in story, structure, character, dialogue, and in preparing scripts for casting and production.

Mikhael Bassilli, writer-producer-director, award-winning screenwriter and CEO of Play Think Entertainment, currently filling his production slate with "the best of the best" projects from established and promising screen and TV writers.

Jerry London, director-producer, nominated for multiple Emmys, DGA award-winner, with more than 100 major film and television projects including Shogun, Chiefs, Ellis Island.

Ron Friedman, legendary writer-producer, among the most prolific television writers of all time, the man behind Transformers, G.I. Joe, and Fantastic Four. Longtime USC and Chapman University professor of screenwriting.

Garner Simmons, writer-producer responsible for such hits as Yellow Rose, Poltergeist, The Last Samurai. Author of the seminal Peckinpah: A Portrait in Montage.

Ray Austin, writer-producer-director with more than 300 credits ranging from The Saint and Magnum, P.I. to Zorro, Highlander, and Six Million Dollar Man.
